term.title: isotopic fractionation factor

item.text: The ratio x 1 x 2 A x 1 x 2 B is the abundance, expressed as the atom fraction of the isotope distinguished by the subscript numeral, when the two isotopes are equilibrated between two different chemical species A and B (or between specific sites A and B in the same or different chemical species). The term is most commonly met in connection with deuterium solvent isotope effects, when the fractionation factor Φ expresses the ratio: for the exchangeable hydrogen atoms in the chemical species (or sites) concerned. The concept is also applicable to transition states.
